Who We Are

KoteGlo

I was browsing the web when I came across a website based on facts about water Water.Org and realized they have one of the most compelling and comprehensive database in regards to facts about water and worldwide water consumption. This stems from my visit to Haiti in which I observed water being a major issue in the country, in regards to availability and cleanliness. The one thing I did observe everyone to have was a cellphone, so I thought to myself, how could I combine existing technologies to benefit the people living there.

Alright, so what does this actually do, the goal would be for user to log in and either report where water and clean lavatory services are located. A user can also go and located other users who have access to clean water and attempt to contact or just visit depending on distance.

Interesting Facts

663 million people - 1 in 10 - lack access to safe water.1,2

2.4 billion people - 1 in 3 - lack access to a toilet. 1,2

Twice the population of the United States lives without access to safe water. 1,2

1/3 of the global population lives without access to a toilet.1,2

More people have a mobile phone than a toilet.1,3

A review of rural water system sustainability in eight countries in Africa, South Asia, and Central America found an average water project failure rate of 20 - 40 percent.4

Globally, 1/3 of all schools lack access to safe water and adequate sanitation.1

In low and middle-income countries, 1/3 of all healthcare facilities lack a safe water source. 1

The water crisis is the #1 global risk based on impact to society (as a measure of devastation), as announced by the World Economic Forum in January 2015. 5

Our Goal

With a building and thriving user base, additional features, KoteGlo has the potential to be the de facto webapp in regards to a crowd sourcing essential resources in 3rd world countries. The potential to assist in locating electricity, food, medication, or even jobs can assist other countries in developing from within.

Self-sustaining economies have the potential for expanding community ownership and affect decisions made by global leaders. The ability to locate clean water sources will reduce carbon emissions and have positive influences towards complications stemming from global warming. One can surmise that it is not the responsibility of respective countries, but citizens of the world who have adequate problem solving resources can aide in the fight against malnutrition, extreme thirst, starvation and death by preventable diseases. As we have come upon global interconnectivity, we can also realize the potential we have in regards to assisting others.
